website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for a well-constructed wall-mounted bar.
pros: This sturdy bar is powder coated and doesn't wobble during use
53-inch bar that can be configured for custom widths

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured or measured. Bait and switch.
customer_reviews.text: I received a completely different product than advertised. The one I received is small and thin. I bought wood and bolts based on the advertised size. The one they sent is maybe 40” wide (not 53”) x 14” tall (not remotely 31”) x 24” deep (also far cry from advertised depth). This is a complete waste of time and money. Do NOT buy from these guys. All the 5 start reviews are 2-3+ years ago. Bait and switch garbage. This is going back today.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: One for the Commandant, One for the Corps
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it to the wall with wood as others had done. It's solid and like how I could set the width of the support arms. Have put athletic tape around the bar since installing, but it gets a lot of use. Pull-ups, ring dips, hanging resistance bands...etc. Packaging was sketchy, but everything came intact and not roughed up. Also, I did not have an issue with the bar fitting through the support, as some have...it fit perfectly fine. ***comes with no hardware*** Side note: nevermind the lower left bolt...that was my bad over tightening and had to drill a new hole.
customer_reviews.author: MRanbo

customer_reviews.title: Solid and good price.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Thankfully I had read the reviews where people had trouble putting the bar in, so I left the lag bolts loose while I mounted the bar, then tightened them. It's so solid! I used Spax brand lags from HD as I think they're (probably) stronger than standard no name and mine were longer since mounted 2x8's on my drywall for an 'old school' gym feel and options for adding wall mounted accessories. It doesn't move at all when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Bolts of low quality.  One sheared in half.
customer_reviews.text: The bar and arms themselves appear to be of good quality. That said one of the bolts sheared in half. I'm 150lbs and I am the heaviest person that used it for the 5 days we had it. Returning for refund and purchasing a quality floor mount model instead. It is just too risky to rely on lag bolts of such low quality when they are the only thing between you and certain injury.
customer_reviews.author: oldnorthstate

customer_reviews.title: BUY YOUR OWN LAG BOLTS
customer_reviews.text: Bar was delivered tonight and I immediately went to install it in my garage in the area I had designated to use it. Measures everything out and even predrilled the holes for the bolts. Two of the six bolt heads snapped off before they rig was tight to the wall. Now the entire thing has to come down and be moved to different height because the bolts are stuck in the wall. I would recommend sending quality bolts with this kit, not cheap aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding bar for CrossFit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for home training during the pandemic. I’m an avid CrossFiter. I hung it in my garage and it has held up great. I do butterfly chest to bars no problem on it. I weigh 188 lbs and have had friends at 215 do kipping pull-ups as well. The powder coat is outstanding. Great grip without being tough on hands. I’ve done WODs with 120 TTB and no tears. I ran 1x6 horizontally over the drywall the length of the pull up bar. I also bought new lags that are 1/2 inch longer. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Measure twice, cut once! I used 1" x 2" as a base for the unit. I hung the top of the brackets close to 8'. I plan to use hanging ads straps also purchased through Amazon. Assembly is very easy. It takes more time to find wall studs (hung mine on dry wall) measure your hanging height and then drill holes. If you've done the measurements correctly things should go well. Tip: make sure you have a longer level with vertical and horizontal bubbles ---it makes it much easier. I weigh 220 pounds and this unit is SOLID
customer_reviews.author: EdoardoG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank. This bar is rigid and the finish seems durable. I did have trouble fitting the bar through the holes after mounting but that was because the alignment was not perfect. I know that was the problem because I fit the bar before I started. I think if they enlarged the hole a bit the reviews would be more favorable. I advise using 2x4s and 6" lag bolts if you are mounting the bar on drywall (like I did).
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: top quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and easy to install. Mounted with 6 3" lag screws. I really like the versatility of the width that it can be mounted, from 12",24" or 36". I had the room so I mounted at maximum width. Holds my weight, 175 lbs easily with kipping and t2b. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Denealian

customer_reviews.title: Plan Ahead
customer_reviews.text: Took good advice from previous reviews and got my own HeadLOK 4 1/2” screws to use instead of 3/8” lag screws. Used washers and lock washers. Mounted 1x6” lumber on the wall and the the pull up bar. I also waited to tighten everything until all parts were in place. Snugged it all - 1 hour install. I am not a good DIY guy.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger E. Broome

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pull up bar!
customer_reviews.text: The grip and stability of this pull up bar is outstanding! I installed it right behind my desk at work - I hate pull ups - so instead of fighting them, I made them an easy daily routine that looms over my shoulder, all of three feet away. Just beat my record yesterday. It's a bar - you pull yourself up and it works (like magic - ohhhhhh!). Very solid feel and again, great grip and texture on the bar. No wobble or security issues if you get it in the studs. One note - keep in mind this thing is super wide - so read the measurements before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Bort

customer_reviews.title: Great pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: Great pull-up bar. Sturdy, As advertised. Even included 4” bolts with washers for mounting which I was not expecting. I used three pieces of 1”x4” wood under the mounts and used four 6” lag bolts on the top and bottom holes on each side and two of the included 4” bolts on the two middle holes. Very solid on the wall. Zero movement. I may replace the two 4” bolts with two more 6” ones for added piece of mind. It took me about a half hour to install. Very satisfied with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo M.

customer_reviews.title: Very solid
customer_reviews.text: This product is very solidly built. I did not anticipate how large these brackets are. That's not bad, if you have the right space for them. But what may look reasonably small on a gym wall, might loom very large in your garage. So pay attn. to the space you plan to hang it on. They just didn't fit where I had planned to put them, and I should have paid more attn. to the actual measurements, rather than picturing how I thought it would fit.
customer_reviews.author: Magdan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product but very poor shipment packaging
customer_reviews.text: The supports and bar are excellent quality. Built very strong and powder coat is high quality. A couple of the plastic end caps were damaged because of bad packaging. The packaging that the heavy supports and bar come in sucks. Flimsy cardboard triangle that was broken open and torn on ends where the bar protruded out. There have to be better cardboard protective packages that would work better to prevent damage during shipment. Figure it out. You make a great product. Don't compromise it by shipping it in what basically is a paper wrapper.
customer_reviews.author: jksurferdad

customer_reviews.title: Buy It.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a really good price. This thing is well built, heavy, sturdy and worth every penny. It's bigger than I thought it would be. I did look at the product specs and knew the size but having it in person makes it seem bigger than the pictures. It's wide and sticks out from the wall pretty far. Mounting hardware is included but I used RSS screws per another reviewers suggestion. Mounted it to the studs in my wall with 1x4 oak boards used in between the wall and the supports. If you are looking for a good solid pull up bar this is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: DanM

customer_reviews.title: Good bar, terrible mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Bar itself is great. Good construction and feels solid. The hardware, as others have mentioned, is basically worthless. Two bolts snapped as I was installing, leaving me concerned to even use the rest. I went to the hardware store to replace all the hardware. Would have given 5 stars but I felt after paying a decent amount for this bar, they could have at least included better mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PULLUP BAR
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with this product. I've had this for 5 weeks and have done about 1,000 pullups. Seems solidly constructed. I drilled it directly to the wall (no board in between). I do get a creaking sound from the upper left side of the mounted bar on my way down. I check the bolts every couple hundred pullups and they are still solidly in the wall. You can go with slightly larger bolts if you wish. I'm 170 lbs and feel secure doing pullups. With the provided bolts, I'd feel safe with someone up to 200 lbs but over that and I'd want bigger bolts.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I have to say I was very impressed with the quality of the bar. The quality of the welds are not beautiful but nothing that I can pick on at this time. Only time will tell how they hold up. When mounted property, this bar is very solid and doesn't move at all when I am on it and I am 215 lbs. I got the idea for this set up from another reviewer, so thanks! I mounted it to some 2x10s, and bought 6 3/8th lag bolts that were 6 inches long to secure the bar to the wall. Very happy with how it turned out!
customer_reviews.author: Rami I.

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid for 315lb’er
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid. I started using at about 315lbs. Used massive lag bolts to anchor into studs and it’s rock solid. I mounted a piece of 2x4 vertically behind both sides to keep the metal from digging into the dry wall. Just used an impact and drove 8” (I think) lag bolts (3 per side) through the pull up bar, the vertical 2x4, and into the studs. Solid as a rock. No fear of it coming off the wall. Very impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: mafu_ry

customer_reviews.title: Blends in well if you paint it!
customer_reviews.text: This bar is very sturdy, I had to buy my own hardware as I could only go with 3 inch bolts due to wall thickness, so I drilled in the bar and added 4 extra bolts. It is very sturdy and I love having this in my apartment. I painted the frame white with the same paint as my wall and put some white grip tape on the bar too so it blends in very well (See pics) can't beat this pull-up bar for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Kostek

customer_reviews.title: Use your own lag screws!
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is a tremendous value. The bar is sturdy, and the brackets are well made. I installed mine outdoors, so I expect it will eventually rust a bit. No problem. The one thing I would insist on is using your own hardware (lag screws). I drilled a pilot hole into my 2x4s (3/16”) but one of the lag screws provided twisted off into the wall. I was lucky to be able to remove it with an easyout. The lag screws seemed a bit small anyways. I used 3/8” x 4” lag screws I had after I removed the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this one after searching for a while. The reviews were good except for the possibility of the package being beat up in shipping. That didn’t happen for me so I thought I’d dodged the biggest issue. Unfortunately after installing the side support pieces and sliding the bar into place I discovered that one of the two nuts tack welded in place to hold the bolts that tighten down the bar wasn’t securely welded. As soon as I began to tighten the bolt the nut raised on one side. My hope now is that the other nut holds the bar adequately so it doesn’t turn while I’m doing pull-ups. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own lag screws
customer_reviews.text: It’s all simple to install as long as you have basic knowledge of anchoring to a wall. The only issue I had was the lag screws were very cheap and snapped off when I tried to snug the assembly to the wall. I went to Lowe’s and bought some 4 inch galvanized lags. Another issue I had was no there was no knurling on the bar so I wrapped with athletic tape. Other than that it’s pretty stout and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Only reason for 4 stars is you have to buy the screws and washers to install it. Other than that it was a great buy for the price! Really good quality pull up bar and very sturdy installed on wall studs. Great for strict, kipping, or butterfly pull-ups. Can't go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous2

customer_reviews.title: Lazy Manufacturing, but Good
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product, with easy instructions. The instructions, however, were taped inside by the external packaging tape, so they tore (cool). The manufacturing is what dinged it for me. There was pieces of material still inside the product, so the pull bar pieces sounded like a rain stick. I had to clean it up outside, and wipe it down so I wouldn’t inhale it when I assembled it- took longer to do than putting it on my wall. Yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna S.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Mine came with hardware
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Mine came with hardware. Not the tools tho but I was lucky to already have the needed tools. Holds up to the 500lb rating with just the hardware that is included. No extra setup is necessary although I see other people have done that for even higher capacity. Anyways I am 200lbs and my sister is 160lbs and we can both do weighted pullups at the same time no problem. I probably wouldn't go over the 500lb rating though unless u do have some sort of added custom setup. All that being said I love it for weighted calisthenics and my ceiling is high enough I can do muscle ups on it too
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase for Price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward setup. I was able to use lag bolts that it came with. Installed in garage which went through sheet rock then onto studs. I'm 6'4" and 210 pounds and it easily supports my weight. Very sturdy. Tools used: Rachet Set Hammer Drill Leveler Lags Bolts (came with) Washers (came with) Two people for installation recommended (my opinion). We had it up and tested within 30 minutes. You'll save about 30-40 bucks if you use what tools it came with. So, there some more info for budget.
customer_reviews.author: John Lovinggood

customer_reviews.title: Great Pull-up Bar, Questionable Hardware
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome pull-up bar, very much comparable to the models or brands that cost over double the price (eg Rogue). Very easy to set up, width can be adjusted for preference or stud width. However, when I was hand tightening the lag bolts, one easily snapped right off in the wall. This was my last bolt, so I’m not about to move the whole setup for one bolt. No big deal though, spend an extra 5-10 for hardware and you have a bulletproof pull-up bar.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised, its smaller. It's smaller I'm depth and height. Also, a thinner medal than one I bought preciously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: If you do not already have a pull-up bar, this is the one to get! It looks and feels like something you would find in an expensive gym. My husband said it was easy enough for anyone to install, and was complete with all the right hardware. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cst000000

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It DOES INCLUDE HARDWARE! (I saw some reviews asking what screws etc to buy, but it came with it all for me). I am 200+ lbs, mounted this on 2x4 studs on one of my house walls, and have no issues whatsoever. Last but not least, I had a issue with the delivery but Titan customer service was excellent and got me squared away in no time! Definitely worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: K P

customer_reviews.title: Great for kipping pull ups and muscle ups
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I used some 2x6 across and used long screws into several studs. There is plenty of space for kipping pull ups or even doing muscle ups. Although, keep that in consideration when selecting how high to install so that you don't hit your head on the ceiling when you are extended at the top.
customer_reviews.author: yourpalallen

customer_reviews.title: Good bar, bad mounting hardware. Worth the $$ overall.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for CrossFit. It's mounted to studs underneath drywall with 6" bolts. Don't trust the ones that come with it. Other than getting different hardware, I've been using this for months and have been doing ring dips, kipping pullups, C2B, muscle ups and toes to bar without issue. 160 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jhonson

customer_reviews.title: Gym quality for sure
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Solid piece of equipment. My only complaint as other reviewers have pointed out is the way its shipped and how it arrived. My box was also broken with the bars sticking out. No damage was done but still. It's extremely heavy, and I can see why the carriers have difficulty with with carrying and moving it. My suggestion would be to put compressed foam on the ends inside the box. I think that would help immensely. 5 stars for the equipment 3 stars for the way its shipped
customer_reviews.author: J. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the included lag bolts
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing except that on of the lag bolts snapped while I was hand tightening it. It was the last one so I had to take the whole thing down to drill out the broken bolt and replace it with a thicker one. Wasted an hour of my life because I was lazy and chose to go gnore the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Caz

customer_reviews.title: Great pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’3” 225 lbs and this pull-up bar handles me very well no wiggles, very sturdy. It took me about 10 minutes to install. I installed the bar at 8’ above floor. You will need to mount it on wall studs 48” to center.
customer_reviews.author: TooTall

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bar with lots of clearance away from the wall. I gave it 4 stars for ease of assembly because it was a little tricky to thread the bar through the holes in the supports at the end-- it is difficult to get the holes to line up exactly when mounting to the wall. If you can mount the second support with the bar already threaded through you will not have that problem. Overall I am very pleased with this and would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Berman

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality half the price of rogue
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and definitely exceeded my expectations. The box is large but it has to be. One review on youtube said it did not have hardware..they are wrong it came with hardware that im sure would have been sufficient. I opted to use 3/8”x4” tapcon concrete anchors from home depot. I love this pull up bar and im glad i didnt pay double for a rogue.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Miz

customer_reviews.title: Best gym equipment
customer_reviews.text: When building a home gym a pull up bar is the best investment you can make. Titan nails it. Mounted to wall studs it's rock solid. Even if kipping there is plenty of room and the bar stays put. I hang rings from it and same thing. Way better value than other brands while maintaining the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely sturdy and and am extremely pleased with how easy it was to hang. It is currently hanging down from my garage ceiling (rather than on a wall) and it feels really solid. I'm able to do kipping pull-ups with no hesitation. I also added Titan's wooden rings to do dips and I couldn't be happier. Great addition to the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pullup Bar
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a homemade pullup bar for years using a Lat bar hung from the floor joists in my basement. I moved my home gym in my barn and finally had the room for a real pullup bar so decided on this one. I wish I would have gotten it sooner! It is great and very solid. I look forward to doing pullups again! Plenty of room from the wall and wide enough for me to leave my rings strapped to it and pushed to the side when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We installed it directly against sheet rock with lag bolts into the backing wood studs in our garage. It has been used daily for the past 6 months and is very, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Ordered item, bar is included in description. Received brackets but no bar. Requesting refund. False advertising, steer clear of this manufacturer, must be writing their own "good reviews."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was terrible as others have mentioned but it all got here
customer_reviews.text: Extremely solid pull-up bar. Make sure you align the holes for the bar and put the bar in before tightening everything down to avoid being unable to get the bar in. It is a tight fit. $40 cheaper than Rogue and very solid. Packaging was terrible as others have mentioned but it all got here. I used 5 1/2" lags to mount and sandwiched a piece of 1x4 between the bar/drywall/stud if that helps anyone.
customer_reviews.author: justin medlin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got my Titan Pull Up Bar yesterday day after work and immediately put it up! It arrived with all the hardware needed to mount it and it took less than 10 minutes (I already had a spot ready for it). It is much larger than I had assumed, which is great, I love it. I am already sore from the workout I did to try it out! So Happy!!!!! (Pics to follow...I meant to take them but did pull ups instead).
customer_reviews.author: S. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Straight Forward Design
customer_reviews.text: Solid Product. At my 200 lbs the system holds up just fine while being attached to your standard 2x4 wood studs. The bar feels solid and the outriggers holding the bar offer great sturdiness and confidence during various exercises. The finish on the pull-up bar is good, but offers no extra mesh grip areas like other products. Wrist straps work great in this case without any slippage issues. Enjoy. Go get stronger.
customer_reviews.author: 2k2!NCU

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal quality, tremendous value! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal quality for the price. Easy assembly and very sturdy. Mounted old 2x4s to cinderblock wall (aligned along seams/centerpoint of blocks) used 4in concrete anchors for wood (3-4 per side). Included hardware mounted into wood and cinderblock behind. I’m 215lb and the bar holds all my beef with not so much as a creak. Trial run was a successful “Murph” on Memorial Day. Powder coated finish is helpful on its own for grip, but made excellent with a little chalk. Scratch on the bar was from my own tape removal; product shipped flawlessly. Box was in as best condition imaginable for a seriously assembly of metal piece parts.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cockrell

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is...a solid pull up bar. I lagged it into my rack which is home made out of 4x6 white oak and it is tight. I was a little leery that it would wobble but it stays tight with kipping pull-ups and toes to bar. Easy assembly. I mounted one side tight and then mounted the other side loosely so I could get the round bar in place and then tightened everything up and was done in less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Solid bar and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar is seriously heavy duty. At 6'4" and 245lbs it handled everything I threw at it without budging. Their customer service department is just as solid as their products as well. All in all I'd buy this pull up bar again and will definitely do business with this company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hilldawg

customer_reviews.title: but they wasted 2 hours of my life having to travel to ...
customer_reviews.text: The lag screws snapped in half!!! Two of the 6 while I was screwing it in and I even drilled pilot holes!!!. The pull-up bar itself seems decent, but they wasted 2 hours of my life having to travel to Lowe's to get legitimate lag screws. DO NOT use the lag screws they give you. It is actually dangerous and not very sturdy. Highly recommend getting a pullup bar from a reputable company. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Cara W

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. We needed a good bar but didn’t want to fork out the money to buy the same thing from Rogue. We use this for most CrossFit workouts (muscle up, pull up, toe to bar) and it holds up great. Only took about an hour to install (one person) using basic tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, wide and good wall clearance
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the home gym! Does not move at all w/ 210 lbs + hanging from it. Like the fact that it is wider than many other setups allowing a range of grip widths. Install was straightforward and no issues w/ the included hardware as mentioned in some other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: cdda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and high quality
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar is so worth the price that I would suggest only buying this for the rest of your life! If anyone brings up wanting a pull up bar this is what I suggest. For this price you honestly can’t get a better one. It does take about 30 minutes to install. But I can now do pull ups any time in my house and not be worried about damaging anything!
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great equipment! I ran into a small issue when I measured several times and ensured it was leveled spot on. Would you believe I was still slightly off on installing the bar. I made it easy by loosening the bottom screw enough to slide the bar on. Overall outstanding. Very sturdy and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: David Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Great bar for the price. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Came as advertised. Packaging was terrible (photo shows how package arrived) but not a big deal because it is built like a tank. Installed easily and works well. I didn't realize the bar doesn't come with mounting hardware but didn't have a problem finding it at the hardware store. Supports my 200lbs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rebarbo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: So far so good seems very sturdy I’m 200 pounds and no problem holding up my weight it’s also in my yard out in the elements and it’s holding up also have used gymnastics rings on the pull up bar and sturdy as Hell good job Titan
customer_reviews.author: Jay Veg

customer_reviews.title: Great bar
customer_reviews.text: Love this bar! Waited a while to submit a review, but this thing is great. As other have mentioned, the box may be a little sketchy after being shipped... Mine came missing on bolt, but I worked around it. In the end, I ended up with one strong, sturdy pull up bar that I love.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Screw broke when tightening it
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually give bad reviews. One of the screw was snapped when I tightened it. I wasn't even using an impact gun. I was just tightening it was a wrench. I tried to find the torque specs for tightening before the installation but there's none. Now I have a screw stuck in my wall and no way to get out. I have to drill more holes in my wall and move this bar. It looks good and I really want to like it, but now I don't even feel confident anymore with the snapped screw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The centerpiece for my home gym
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install after reading other people’s instructions. I initially used the supplied1/4” lag bolts. It was very sturdy using 3/8”x4” lag bolts with a washer and lock-washer, even going through the 1/2” decorative planks. Very happy with the end result.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Redlands

customer_reviews.title: Support for heavy lift operations - a back saver.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty unit, but well designed, was able to install myself. I purchased and used 3/8x5-inch lag screws, long enough to clear the frame, 1x4 wood mount, 1/2 inch dry wall, and 3 inches into centers of wall studs. Small nit, the plastic end caps were loose fitting. Using as a frame for near-to-ceiling sliding rail that supports a 30-pound electric hoist in home brewery. Has 400 pound dead weight lift capacity, back saver. A few pull-ups might be in order as well. High enough that the diagonal struts don't get in the way of work flow. Install guide urges careful execution but is sparse on details.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Train for the Spartan Army!  Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hang outside on my out building. Unfortunately it did not fit the building the way I liked. The seller agreed to let me return the item. I am writing this to let everyone know this is absolutely incredibly well made. the steel is thick and the bar is virtually unbend-able. If this will fit where you want it, then do not hesitate to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Flynn's Tron

customer_reviews.title: This thing is heavy duty and rather large. you ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty and rather large. you are not stuck right up against the wall for your pull ups. I got this one because it's not a fixed with, so you can mount the bars on studs no matter if you are 16 or 18 on center. The cross bar is about 54 inches sh there is plenty of width to work with. The competing model was a fixed width that would have caused problems if my studs where not evenly spaced.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, just be careful not to overtighten
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to install. 2 of the 6 lag screws broke when I was tightening to the wall and needed to be replaced (cheap at the hardware store), so be careful not to overtighten. Drilled pilot holes using a 1/4" bit and tightened with a socket wrench and 1/2" socket. A larger socket was needed to tighten the screws to secure the bar. My beams are 52" apart and the width was perfect to use the entire bar. Very solid and sturdy. I like how far out it hangs, not too close to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of gear! I used 1x12s to protect the drywall and add some additional stability. Leave the lags loose before you put in the bar to make things easier. This thing is rock solid and only one brace easily held my weight (185 lbs).
customer_reviews.author: S. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best purchases I have ever made. I'm particularly happy that I did no purchase one of those cheap doorway pull up bars. This pull up bar arrived in perfect condition. No scratches or scraped paint. The welds are strong and the construction is solid. The there were no sharp or unfinished edges. The pipe I.D. is a perfect fit for inserting standard barbell bars. Since I have several of those this great for extensions. The box, that this unit came in, must have given the UPS people a fit because of the triangle shape. The cardboard was pretty well shredded but I did not buy it for the box.
customer_reviews.author: bbqdhampster

customer_reviews.title: Best for the $
customer_reviews.text: Just put this up in the garage yesterday, over my doorway. It is sturdy, and the finish looks good. I’ve only used it for one day, but at 205 pounds, there is no hesitation that I can do any type of work out on this without a problem. I did purchase my own lag bolts, because I wasn’t very confident in what came in the packaging. They did not look bad, but I trust my local hardware store more. So far, very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Adam schermerhorn

customer_reviews.title: Installed in my garage
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use it, it’s mostly for looks. All of my neighbors and friends see it and think I’m beast because I have a pull up bar. My kids friends love it and try to show off to each other.
customer_reviews.author: The King

customer_reviews.title: Great bar.
customer_reviews.text: Great bar but replace the bolts. They snap easily when tightening down.
customer_reviews.author: elaw

customer_reviews.title: Although a problem, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Shout out to Steven. He went the extra mile and finally explained the bar only has one hole in one side. A lot of confusion on this point. The instructions clearly point to each end screwing into the wall attachment. OK, well at least this is over. Steven was great.
customer_reviews.author: sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Solid Chin Up Bar with Crappy Hardware
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty chin up bar as described. Mostly happy with it but one of the main bolts sheared in half during installation. Not something you expect to happen using a hand socket wrench.
customer_reviews.author: faqby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Well constructed and properly finished. Very sturdy. All mounting hardware was included. Good value for the money. I will definitely purchase more of their products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SonoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: This was easy for 2 of us to install. The two side brackets can slide along the main bar so that they can be attached however far apart your studs are. The bar holds my 250 lb husband with no problem, and we will also be hanging our TRX suspension training system from it, so that's a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no issues with this pull up bar. I read others had minor issues with the holes, but mine were perfectly fine. Solid equipment!! Packaging was a bit beat up, but for what it weighs, I'd say it's almost expected. Also purchased their wood rings and so far they seem like great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: It nice buy it
customer_reviews.text: Packing sucked so it came In a little scratched up but other then that this product is very nice. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: the product is very sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated, the product is very sturdy and well built. The welds look solid and the finish of the metal looks good. I've installed it on top of 1x4's mounted on top of drywall and it feels completely solid. If you're going to get this make sure you have the right tools to install it and you're comfortable installing something like this.
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: I like the pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: This is the first of 3 Titan fitness products I have purchased. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a substantial pull-up bar built with quality in mind. Very heavy duty and fairly easy to hang. I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Davis

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy another one!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my small fitness studio and I am very pleased with the cost to value. I researched many commercial and light commercial pull-up bars and this was the only one that offered an affordable price with a 500 Lb capacity!
customer_reviews.author: P. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Two bolts snapped in half while assembling.
customer_reviews.text: While assembling, I somehow managed to snap two of the six anchor bolts with just a socket set. I was not leveraging that much pressure. Prior to this I had trouble getting the chin up bar to fit snug against the 1” backing I have in my garage. The assembly did not feel as stable as you would want for continued use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... the bar itself is very well made and I love it. The issue I have is like other ...
customer_reviews.text: So the bar itself is very well made and I love it. The issue I have is like other the box it showed up in was destroyed. part of the bar braces were sticking out of the side. It is amazing nothing was lost in shipment.
customer_reviews.author: G3

customer_reviews.title: Solid bar for pullups and other exercises
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality. It can easily handle my 250lbs. My wife has used it for pullups and TRX workouts. I didn't use the included wall bolts. I bought lag bolts for the bar. Mounted it to 6 2x6s that were screwed to the studs using 4" Spax washer head Powerlags. This baby isn't going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a tank. Mounted to a block wall and it's sturdy as a jug. Used 2- 2x4's tapconed the first one to the wall with 3 1/4 tapcons and screwed second 2x4 into the first with 3 inch screws. Then used lag bolts that were provided to tie it all together. I used a home made pull up bar for a long time. This is the best money I've spent in a while. If thinking about it, get it. I've never had a rouge bar but I don't know how it could be much better than this. Thanks Titan fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Framer123

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Due to location over garage, installed upside down. Used 3/8" x 4" tapcons into solid masonry wall. Needs athletic tape on bar for grip.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN KNOWLES

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, high quality gear!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Super heavy duty and high quality. Easy to mount on wood studs using included lag bolts. Had it installed in 45 minutes. Just finished working out with it for the first time, and it is rock solid. Great buy! Gym quality!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Need 2 people. Not sure how sturdy it is but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: John Kim

customer_reviews.title: So far so great.
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of the Rogue Fitness one. I bought thicker and longer lag screws, and put a 1x4 between each bracket and the wall. Very sturdy even for me at 6'5" 208 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Stacavich

customer_reviews.title: Insanely awesome ....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sons wrestling gym and let me tell you ...This thing is legit ... It is so big and so heavy and so strong I'm surprised it sells for 80 bucks I know people say this all the time but this bar is the best part of my gym ... Just get 3-4 people to help you hang it because it's a monster ...
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for training purposes and it works great. No issues with assembly or installation
customer_reviews.author: Hamfam

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We got it up fairly quickly. Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing addition to a home gym.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as part of our home gym. My husband installed it with four 2x10s bolted into four studs with 3/8” lag bolts, and I do believe it could support an elephant. The box was torn open during shipping, but all parts were intact and unharmed.
customer_reviews.author: michaela johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great and sturdy product for good price
customer_reviews.text: Great and sturdy product for good price. Received in damaged packaging. Missing end caps. Used my own anchors (longer and stronger) versus what was provided.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Product was poorly packaged, surface rust all over the ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was poorly packaged, surface rust all over the product. I get "you get what you pay for" but dang, LOTS of surface rust and ripped box. The unit also comes with concrete anchors instead of lag bolts. I assume 90% of these installations are into wood, would make sense to provide fasteners for such.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bar
customer_reviews.text: Solid metal, very sturdy. The bar length can be adjusted to fit studs. We decided to keep the bar the right length and mount on 2x4s that are mounted in the studs. Love using it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennabeebs

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on garage wall. The spacing of the supports provides for the nice wide bar. We've had two other bars and this is the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: Fair price for good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good product a very fair price, sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amezky Ing

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, hardware kit is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The bar and bracket seem ok but the mounting hardware is a joke. Don’t waste your time trying to use it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Exellent product...!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item by a mistake and I had to returned, but I have to buy it again in the future because is a really exellent item...
customer_reviews.author: EL Yuni

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. If you will be mounting into concrete, you will need to purchase your own hardware. Only comes with wood screws.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a bit of a challenge but this thing is a beast. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Holds my 240 no problem. I anchored 1x2 to ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 240 no problem. I anchored 1x2 to the wall studs first, then mounted the bar to the 1x2. Solid. Also use it to hold my trx. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: great pull up bar, perfect for the price. i'm a heavy guy and it is solid as a rock. good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Black

product_meta.title: TITAN HD Pull Up Bars
feature_bullets: Capacity: 500 lbs - Can be installed vertically or horizontally
Can be mounted via 16" wood studs for custom widths at 16", 32" or 52" apart - Mount on concrete wall at any width up to 48" with supplied bar
Height: Can be adjusted based on ceiling height or athlete height - Purchase standard 1" steel tube(1.3" OD) and extra L brackets to make a multiple person pull up station
Weight: 35 lbs - Bracket Height: 31" - Bracket Depth: 32"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
